job_title: Pre Silicon System Emulation and Debug Engineer
job_description:
• Recent, prior years of semiconductor development with focused experience in emulation and other shift left technologies and processes Hands-on experience validating low-power states such as S0i3 in pre-silicon emulation environments, including debug of entry/exit flows and dependencies across firmware and hardware componentsKnowledge of computer system architecture and microprocessor developmentDemonstrated success in product verification, emulation, and post silicon validationAbility to structure and execute complex analysis, draw insights, and communicate summary findings/recommendations to senior management and to AMD customersAbility to network, build relationships, and drive effective decision-making across multiple functions and levels within the organizationHighly organized, able to prioritize, and juggle multiple work streams to tight deadlinesKnowledge of Verilog, C, C++, assembly, TCL/TK, Python, and/or other scripting languages AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Direct focus on the goals of improving product time-to-market, quality of hardware, firmware, software, lowering development costsWork with various pre-silicon tools and concepts such as emulation, FPGA, software models, N-1 silicon usage, etc.
• , including pre-to-post-silicon initiativesContribute to high-priority issue debug and execution on critical projectsDrive new capabilities and technologies to effectively enhance system validation quality and coverage prior to silicon arrivalLead defining shift left strategies for new products with customersDefine key metrics to facilitate and track improvementsCollaborate with other business units within AMD to share learning and best practices Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings.
